info.title: Network API
info.description:
This documentation is a technical manual for the ActiveProspect Network API. It is primarily intended to be read by software
developers who want to integrate another system with the network.

The API is RESTful and speaks JSON over HTTPS. In general, anything that can be accomplished by pointing and
clicking in ActiveProspect application user interfaces can also be done using this API.

If you have a question, or spot an error in the documentation, or just generally need to speak with someone about the API,
send an email to [support@activeprospect.com](mailto:support@activeprospect.com).

tags.name: Company
tags.description: This resource is for working with your company.

tags.name: Companies
tags.description:
This resource serves as a directory of companies that have chosen to appear on the network. A company
profile describes a business who participates in the consent-based marketing industry.

To connect with a company, create a new connection invitation. Once recipient accepts your invitation,
a new connection will appear in the connections resource.

tags.name: Connections
tags.description:
A connection is made when one company on the network invites another to connect and
the receiving company accepts the invitation.

The owner of an offer can share it with other accounts on the network to which the owner is connected.
That gives the other account permission to participate in the offer. If it's a buyer-owned offer, the
buyer shares an offer with their sellers. And those sellers share it with theirs, and so on. If it's a
seller-owned offer, the seller shares it with their buyers. When the owner of an offer shares it with
another company on the network, an “Offer Share” is created.

tags.name: Invitations
tags.description:
Invitations are the primary means two companies becoming connected. A company in the network invites
another company to connect. Invitations are emailed to the recipient of the invitation. The recipient
can accept or simply take no action.

If the recipient of the invitation does not belong to an existing company within the network, the
recipient will be prompted to create a new account.

If the recipient is already a member of the network and has memberships with multiple companies, the
recipient will be prompted to select the company with which they would like to connect.
